content:
Diagnosis
	1. Anaplastic thyroid carcinoma with TERT and TP53 mutations
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Total thyroidectomy with level VI neck dissection
	Complicated by left recurrent laryngeal nerve palsy

	Radiotherapy
	1 Feb - 15 Feb 2024
	Palliative IMRT 30Gy in 10 fractions to thyroid bed and bilateral neck

	Chemotherapy
	Weekly Paclitaxel/Carboplatin commenced 20 Feb 2024
	Discontinued after cycle 3 due to disease progression

	Clinical studies
	Not eligible for current trials due to brain metastases

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new brain metastases and enlarging lung metastases

	Current issues
	1. Increasing dyspnoea requiring oxygen 3L/min
	2. Left vocal cord palsy with intermittent aspiration
	3. Headaches and mild confusion

	Summary of consultation
	This 68-year-old gentleman has unfortunately shown rapid progression of his anaplastic thyroid cancer despite initial multimodal therapy. Recent MRI brain from 15 April 2024 shows multiple new cerebral metastases with the largest measuring 2.8cm in right frontal lobe with surrounding edema. CT thorax shows enlarging bilateral pulmonary metastases with new malignant pleural effusion.

He has deteriorated significantly over the past two weeks with increasing confusion, persistent headaches, and worsening breathlessness. His performance status has declined from ECOG 1 to ECOG 3. He requires increasing oxygen support and assistance with most activities of daily living.

On examination today, he is drowsy but rousable, oriented to person only. Oxygen saturations 94% on 3L/min oxygen. Bilateral decreased air entry with dullness to percussion at both bases. Neurological examination shows new right-sided weakness grade 4/5.

	Further investigations
	Urgent CT head arranged for tomorrow

	Medication prescribed
	Dexamethasone 8mg BD commenced
	Ondansetron 4mg TDS PRN
	Oxycodone MR 10mg BD

	Follow up
	Urgent referral to local palliative care team
	Transfer of care to [redacted name] Hospital palliative care unit arranged

	Required GP actions
	Please support palliative care referral
	Prescribe breakthrough medications as per palliative care team recommendations
